headline: Apple deepens its ties to a Kentucky plant that produces cover glass for iPhone and Apple Watch
summary: Apple is putting its trust in a Kentucky plant singled out to become the exclusive producer of the cover glass meant to safeguard every iPhone and Apple Watch sold worldwide by the tech giant.  Specialty glass maker Corning Inc. said Friday it plans to triple production capacity at its plant in Harrodsburg and increase the workforce there by 50%, deepening its relationship with Apple that began when the original iPhone launched in 2007.  The Harrodsburg plant made the glass for those first iPhones.

The Harrodsburg plant made the glass for those first iPhones.

headline: Exclusive-Vista-backed device management software firm Jamf explores a sale, sources say
summary: (Reuters) -Device management software provider Jamf is exploring a sale as weakness in its stock price makes it a prime takeover candidate for other companies, according to people familiar with the matter.  Jamf, which is backed by Vista Equity and has a market capitalization of roughly $1.4 billion, is working with investment bankers at Citigroup on the sale, said the people, who requested anonymity speaking about private deal deliberations.  Vista Equity, which owns 34% of the company’s stock, is expected to exit its position in the company as part of Jamf’s sale, the people said.

raw.headline: Exclusive-Vista-backed device management software firm Jamf explores a sale, sources say
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Device management software provider Jamf is exploring a sale as weakness in its stock price makes it a prime takeover candidate for other companies, according to people familiar with the matter.  Jamf, which is backed by Vista Equity and has a market capitalization of roughly $1.4 billion, is working with investment bankers at Citigroup on the sale, said the people, who requested anonymity speaking about private deal deliberations.  Vista Equity, which owns 34% of the company’s stock, is expected to exit its position in the company as part of Jamf’s sale, the people said.

headline: AppLovin Stock Could Rise 25%, Analyst Says. Here’s Why.
summary: AppLovin  stock has rallied this year, and one analyst says the mobile technology company is poised for further gains.  Wedbush analyst Alicia Reese reiterated an Outperform rating on shares and hiked her price target to $725 from $620 in a note Friday.  AppLovin  which provides marketing and monetization tools for mobile app developers, was finally tapped to join the  index earlier this month after being passed over in the previous rebalancing.

headline: Mag 7 Stocks Are About to Be a $20 Trillion Market Problem
summary: Shares of Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla together had a market cap of $19.88 trillion, as of yesterday's close.  Collectively they are worth more than the entire GDP of every country except for the U.S., according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Currently the S&P 500 market cap is $55.896 trillion, which means Mag 7 makes up 35.9% of the index.

headline: Apple Postpones Release of New iPhone Air in Mainland China
summary: When pre-orders for the new models began on Friday, the company’s China website would not let customers in the region order the new, thinner device.  The iPhone maker previously said that the new product would become available in the region Sept. 12 for pre-order and on Sept. 19 for general availability, matching the US and other major markets.  An Apple spokesperson didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.
